meanings.definition: A person or thing that consummates or completes something.
meanings.sent1: The consummator of the puzzle was the final piece that made it whole.
meanings.sent2: The artist was the consummator of the masterpiece, adding the finishing touches.
meanings.sent3: The consummator of the party was the cake, bringing everyone together for a sweet celebration.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was the consummator of the room, brightening up the dull atmosphere.
meanings.sent5: The key was the consummator of the lock, finally opening the door to reveal the hidden treasure.

meanings.definition: One who brings a process to completion.
meanings.sent1: The teacher was the consummator of the science experiment, guiding the students to the final results.
meanings.sent2: The chef acted as the consummator of the meal, ensuring every dish was cooked to perfection.
meanings.sent3: The consummator of the race was the tortoise, slowly but steadily reaching the finish line first.
meanings.sent4: His signature was the consummator of the contract, sealing the deal with a final flourish.
meanings.sent5: The conductor was the consummator of the symphony, leading the musicians to a harmonious end.

meanings.definition: A person who achieves a goal or fulfills a purpose.
meanings.sent1: She was the consummator of her dream, finally opening her own bakery.
meanings.sent2: The athlete became the consummator of his training, winning the championship.
meanings.sent3: The consummator of the mission was the spy, successfully retrieving the classified information.
meanings.sent4: His graduation was the consummator of years of hard work, marking the beginning of a new chapter.
meanings.sent5: The inventor was the consummator of innovation, creating a groundbreaking technology.
